question.text: The following is an oxygen dissociation curve. The characters depicted on the axes are

options.text:
X axis: partial pressure gradient of oxygen in mm Hg and

Y axis: saturation of haemoglobin with oxygen

X axis: saturation of haemoglobin with oxygen and

Y axis: partial pressure gradient of oxygen in mm Hg

X axis: percentage saturation of haemoglobin with oxygen and

Y axis: partial pressure of oxygen in mm Hg

X axis: partial pressure of oxygen in mm Hg

Y axis: percentage saturation of haemoglobin with oxygen

solution.text: Oxygen dissociation curve is a sigmoid shaped curve. This graph has a partial pressure of oxygen on X-axis and percentage saturation of hemoglobin on the Y-axis. This explains oxygen transport through blood. Right, and left deviations are seen in case of oxygen dissociation near tissues and its association near alveoli with hemoglobin respectively.
